lead_paragraph: Cat Whitehill, a defender for the United States women’s national team, will miss the Olympics after tearing a knee ligament. Whitehill tore the anterior cruciate ligament in her left knee Tuesday during practice in Seoul, South Korea and will have surgery in the next few weeks, according to U.S. Soccer. Whitehill, 26, was a strong candidate to make the 18-player roster for the Beijing Games. She played every minute of the 2007 FIFA Women’s World Cup, was part of the 2004 gold medal-winning team and has appeared in 129 games for the United States.
